website_summaries.verdict: Set to start a legacy of its own, the Keds Champion is a pioneer sneaker emblazoned with simplicity and sophistication while expanding its horizons of function and style. Its prim appeal ironically enlists itself as an all-around sneaker from basic tasks like running errands to casual leisure activities. The minimalist design blends in with almost any clothing which also brings back the classic vibe.
pros: More than 60% of the reviewers gave the Keds Champion favorable comments revolving around its durability, comfort, size, and quality
The sneaker boasts a simple yet fashionable image that can either be dressed up or down expanding different scenarios
Many buyers find the sneaker to be inexpensive which was a feat kept fairly by Keds throughout the years
It is available in varying widths from narrow (S) to extra wide (XW)
The Keds Champion superbly blends in with almost any article of clothing from pants to dresses and many more
Many users have worn them since they were kids and had stayed loyal to the shoe
The canvas material quickly dries when moistened or soaked
The sneaker is adorably cute and feminine
Many utilize the Champion as an everyday foot apparel
The sneaker is advised by someone who does not need an extra pair of shoes for every kind of activity
It is praised to be functional and can be worn in many situations than running shoes
Very few users were astonished that it very well accommodates bunions
cons: Some users experience blisters on the heel due to the stiff material of the back collar
Many customers disgustingly proclaimed that the recent releases of the Keds Champion had either decreased its quality or revamped its construction which became unsuitable for their preference
Most of them requested Keds to revert their production to the previous formula of the sneaker
The laces found on recent iterations of the Champion became thinner and weaker as compared before
The dye of the insole on the white colorway of the sneaker would bleed through the canvas upper and leave blue stain marks when machine washed
The color also tends to spread to socks when the colored footbed becomes wet
Few users noted that the side pieces of rubber along the panels are pulling out from the canvas after some time
The form of the sneaker changed from round toe to long and narrow, according to some reviewers

customer_reviews.title: Best summer pumps ever!
customer_reviews.text: It's taken me ages to fine little white pumps that I like again and I'm so pleased with these that as soon as they arrived and I'd tried them on, I bought the same pair in black. I'm a perfect 4 and they fit like a glove. They have much more support in the insole that I have ever had with little shoes like this. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but stylish.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these specifically to go walking with our dogs. I don't like trainers because they draw the feet. These are extremely comfortable and do the job nicely.

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: These are quite simply the most comfortable shoes I have ever owned! I usually wear a UK 4 and the 4 I ordered fit perfectly. Love them!

product_meta.title: Keds Women's Champion Sneaker
product_meta.description: The very definition of classic sneaker. Our iconic Champion first debuted in 1916, the first rubber-soled canvas shoe of its kind. It’s gone through some changes over time—different toe shapes to play to the trends and getting modern comfort updates—but its signature shape has mostly remained the same, an iconic design that was loved and worn by a legacy of influential women like Audrey Hepburn, Yoko Ono, and Jackie Onassis (to name just a few). With its instantly recognizable minimalist design, goes-with-everything style and all-day comfort, it’s one of the those timeless basics every closet needs.
feature_bullets: Classic canvas upper; 4 eyelet lace up sneaker; Soft breathable lining; Dream Foam footbed; Flexible, textured rubber outsole; Care instructions: spot wash, air dry only;
